intro: Streptocarpus linguatus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers in shades ranging from light to deep hues. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Streptocarpus linguatus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
